posts.text: fair point. But in the "platform for distribution" context, bluesky is the one that would be in trouble here, no? is that an embedded link to Sora's CDN, or did you download the video and attach it to your skeet? in which case, DMCA would hold bsky responsible for the content moderation.

reply_context.text: Dude, the DMCA exists. This is a well trodden path. Sora can allow people to create SpongeBob smoking weed but once they become a platform for distribution then other rules kick in.

posts.text: Either you are personally in violation of IP or your skeet was fair use. But OpenAI isn't in violation anymore than an art school is for producing talented artists.

reply_context.text: training on the content is fair use. whatever the model generates is transformative. the IP violation here wasn't in the model providing you with a transformative work you privately commissioned: it was in your public publication of trademarked characters.

posts.text: training on the content is fair use. whatever the model generates is transformative. the IP violation here wasn't in the model providing you with a transformative work you privately commissioned: it was in your public publication of trademarked characters.
